alert.note: Alert for DuPage; Will (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 17 at 8:54PM CST until February 19 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Illinois... East Branch Du Page River at Bolingbrook affecting Will and DuPage Counties. For the East Branch Du Page River...including Bolingbrook...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...East Branch Du Page River at Bolingbrook. * WHEN...Until early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Low-lying areas of the DuPage River Greenway are inundated along the river near Royce Road in Bolingbrook. Low-lying property inundated at the Royce Road Water Reclamation Facility in Bolingbrook. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:40 PM CST Thursday the stage was 18.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is cresting at this time and is expected to begin a slow fall. - Action stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: These forecasts are based on observed precipitation as well as forecast precipitation 48 hours into the future. Changes to the rainfall forecast, or any additional rainfall after 48 hours, may cause changes to these river forecasts. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/Chicago and water.weather.gov The next statement is expected Friday morning.
